findings.title: MSC - Missing Sanity Check
findings.description: The contract is processing variables that have not been properly sanitized and checked that they form the proper shape, which may produce vulnerability issues.

findings.title: ADO - Array Declaration Optimization
findings.description: The `plans` array is declared with a dynamic length but always has a fixed length of 4, consuming additional storage that could be optimized.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments which can lead to issues like gas efficiency, complexity, readability, security, and maintainability of the source code.

findings.title: IRD - Inconsistent Reward Distribution
findings.description: The contract features a staking flow with a reward mechanism that allows users to claim ETH from the `CloverPot` contract if they stake with a 2-hour delay between stakes. However, the current implementation results in inconsistent reward distribution.

findings.title: AAO - Accumulated Amount Overflow
findings.description: The contract could lead to an overflow when the total value of a variable exceeds the maximum value that can be stored in that variable's data type.

findings.title: TVO - Time Variables Optimization
findings.description: The contract uses repetitively the `1 days` value for certain operations, which could be optimized by using the already calculated and assigned variable `TIME_STEP`, resulting in reduced gas consumption.

findings.title: RCS - Redundant Conditional Statement
findings.description: The `require(plan < 4, "Invalid plan")` check is redundant because plans used for staking are preconfigured and cannot be modified.

findings.title: REA - Redundant Event Argument
findings.description: The `RefBonus` event is declared with an argument called `level`, but it's always given the value of 0 when emitted, making this argument redundant.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: RSK - Redundant Storage Keyword
findings.description: The contract uses the `storage` keyword in a view function which is redundant as view functions do not modify the state of the contract and do not perform any actions that cost gas.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that are initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards, which can be optimized by declaring them as immutable to reduce gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.
